title: Quiz 2: The CHA Process & Data Analysis
topicName: Community Health Diagnosis and Partnership Notes (CHNA)
description: Test your knowledge on the steps of Community Health Needs Assessment, data collection methods, and analysis.

questions.question: Which of the following are recognized components of a Community Health Needs Assessment (CHA)? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: The key components include Data Collection, Analysis, Community Engagement, and Needs Identification. Profit maximization is a business goal, not a CHA component.
questions.hint: Focus on the steps needed to understand community health.

questions.question: Arrange the steps for designing a CHA Methodology in the correct chronological order:
questions.explanation: The process starts with defining goals, reviewing existing info, collecting new data, analyzing it, and then planning improvements.
questions.hint: Planning comes first, action planning comes last.

questions.question: Match the data collection tool/source to its data type:

richContent.content: Note: Distinguish between data collected firsthand vs. existing data.

questions.explanation: Primary data is collected firsthand (surveys, interviews). Secondary data already exists (census, records).
questions.hint: Primary = You collect it. Secondary = Someone else collected it.

questions.question: Which analysis method involves using statistical methods to analyze numerical data?
questions.explanation: Quantitative analysis deals with numbers and statistics. Qualitative/Thematic deals with text/themes.

questions.question: Combining multiple data sources (Quantitative + Qualitative) to validate findings and get a comprehensive view is known as data ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Data triangulation involves using multiple methods or sources to cross-verify information.
questions.hint: It relates to a three-sided shape.

questions.question: Review the scenario below. Which data visualization tool would be BEST to identify the relationship between 'Income Level' and 'Diabetes Prevalence'?

richContent.content: Scenario: You have a dataset with 500 households showing their annual income and whether any member has diabetes. You want to see if higher income correlates with lower diabetes rates.

questions.explanation: Scatter plots are used to identify relationships or correlations between two variables.
questions.hint: This chart plots dots to show patterns between two sets of numbers.

questions.question: What is the acronym for the plan developed after identifying health needs, which sets goals and strategies?
questions.explanation: CHIP stands for Community Health Improvement Plan.
questions.hint: Starts with C, ends with P.

questions.question: Secondary data is information collected firsthand by the assessment team specifically for the current CHA.
questions.explanation: This is false. Primary data is collected firsthand. Secondary data is information that already exists (collected by others).

questions.question: Which of the following are considered 'Health Indicators' in a Community Health Profile? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Mortality, morbidity, and immunization coverage are measurable health indicators. Personal diaries are anecdotal.

questions.question: Why is 'Gap Analysis' important during data analysis?

options.text: To identify discrepancies between community health needs and available services
To increase the cost of the project

questions.explanation: Gap analysis identifies what is missingâ€”the difference between what is needed and what is currently available.
questions.hint: It finds the 'hole' or 'gap' in services.
